subject: Personal Finance
title: Rebalancing Your Portfolio
description: A quick, practical guide to Rebalancing Your Portfolio.

hook.text: Your 70/30 stock-bond mix drifted to 85/15 after a bull market. You're now taking more risk than planned.

buildup.text: Rebalancing means selling winners and buying laggards to restore your target allocation.

discovery.text: It feels wrong â€” selling what's going up and buying what's going down. But it enforces discipline.

twist.text: Rebalancing is a systematic way to 'buy low, sell high' without trying to predict the market.

climax.text: Annual or threshold-based rebalancing keeps your risk level consistent through market cycles.

punchline.text: Rebalancing sells greed and buys discipline.

quiz.question: Why is portfolio rebalancing important?
options: It maintains your intended risk level as markets shift
It eliminates the need for diversification
